title: Factoring the Argument Completely
text: $$7x^2+21x=7x\left(x+3\right)$$. $$(7x(x-1)(x-2))=7x \left(x-1\right) \left(x-2\right)$$. We can now use the product and quotient rules and expand.
speech: 7 x squared, plus 21 x is equal to 7 x, parentheses x plus 3,  .  parentheses 7 x, parentheses x minus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 2,   is equal to 7 x, parentheses x minus 1,  times, parentheses x minus 2,  . We can now use the product and quotient rules and expand.
pacedSpeech: 7 x squared, plus 21 x is equal to 7 x,  x plus 3,
.    7 x,  x minus 1,  times,  x minus 2,   is equal to 7 x,  x minus 1,  times,  x minus 2,
. We can now use the product and quotient rules and expand.

title: Representing the Expression With Many Logarithms
text: Using the quotient and product rules, we can write the expression with many logarithms.
speech: Using the quotient and product rules, we can write the expression with many logarithms.
pacedSpeech: Using the quotient and product rules, we can write the expression with many logarithms.
